Reviews.Title: “Great location next to Emirates Mall”
Reviews.Author: Robe C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great locating if you want to shop, eat and rest, the lobby is nver too full and there is plenty of sinning options, I wished a had more time to enjoy Dubai. But I as only there for a few nights. If you are registering solo, there is NO VISITORS allowed in the rooms, so if you like to bring visitors stay somewhere else, the bars are good, not a large selection of food but its adecuate, along with plenty of TV's always on soccer ofcourse. The breakfast was great, you get omelettes or scrambled eggs to order, room service is timely and nice portions. I did not use the pool or the roof bars, but I would of liked to. I would recommend to others unless you want to bring visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit ...”
Reviews.Author: DH317
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Holiday Inn Al Barsha, and cannot speak highly about it. Upon arrival, we were checked-in quickly and efficently, and were soon on our way to out Suite as the Hotel had upgraded us due to our loyalty level. A large corner suite, which was an immaculate smart boutique style living space. we spent 3 days there before heading off on our Cruise and it was a great place to start a holiday off. The sun terrace with pool may be small and the sunbeds are taken early, but we managed to get two beds with only a small wait. The restaurants are excellent, we especially enjoyed the Indian restaurant. It's only a short walk to the Mall of the Emirates and the hundreds and hundreds of shops which are available there. There is also quite a large food court there if you feel peckish whilst wandering around the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good middle of the road hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mops755
Reviews.Content: Location is always important to us and this one is excellent. Short walk to Mall of the Emirates even in the June heat, and the metro close to. Metro is amazingly clean Hotel is fine, nothing flash but good service, breakfast etc, small pool on the roof with view over to the Burj. Taxi are plentiful so itis easy to get around. Reasonable price in a city of very expensive hotels, but it is out Jumeriah Beach way, not in central Dubai, which an be a blessing!

Reviews.Title: “Spot on location”
Reviews.Author: Foddiiii
Reviews.Content: Great location close by the Emirates Mall, and near to metro station. I've had a studio suite on the fifth floor it was spacious with nice small kitchen was very helpful specially accompanied with a baby

Reviews.Title: “Dubai amazing, hotel satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Anthony S
Reviews.Content: Impressive entrance - well presented, neat and slightly vagazzled. Next to a huge mall so choices to eat out are numerous. Room was OK but I had to ring for a bath plug which was missing. I had to spend the rest of the stay using the teaspoon to flick it back out. (not the entire stay - just a few moments preceeding my daily bath). A lack of forsight / mathematics on my behalf meant I ran out of underpants on day two of a five day sentence and had to use the laundry service which was fine. Having my washing and ironing done - now I know what it's like to be the wife. No wireless in room but free in lobby - and as most websites are blocked anyway... Overall though - no major problems and would stay again - lower end of 4 star though!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diane H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to recharge our batteries after a tiring flight from Sydney and just basically wanted a complete rest which we achieved we ordered room service the first evening and were suitably impressed with the food and not too expensive either, we found the hotel excellent and very convenient for the Mall of the Emirates which was only a few minutes walk from the hotel. The staff are very friendly and most helpful we tried the Indian restaurant and also the Thai in the hotel and both were extremely good food was excellent and not too expensive, roof top terrace is nice, pool is small but adequate, all in all a very good hotel and would thoroughly recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Above average for Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: anettethore
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay there, it was modern, clean, proper, fairly big room, good value for money (for Dubai). It's just a short walk from the Mall of the Emirates. The rooftop bar was empty, so when told they could send for drinks downstairs if we wanted to stay, we decided to go somewhere else entirely. At first I thought it's because rooftop bars are simply not busy in January (and it was particularly cold - for Dubai - on that evening) but that didn't seem to be the problem in other hotels. All in all, I would recommend it as a business hotel: it's got all the basics you need and in no way of lower quality than the fancier places - and much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: slingerman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ten minutes walk from Emirates Mall and well situated for the Metro which will take you to the Marina ,Dubai Mall Bur Dubai tower. very clean and safe. I would not take breakfast at this hotel as it is twice what you pay at one of the nearby cafe,s; Rooms are fine clean and towels are changed twice a day. pool area is fine but at this time of year the area is prone to winds, so we only used the pool twice. The wind can be chilly at night so you may need a sweater or cardigan, nothing more.All in all I would recommend this hotel,as it is central to the Mall and Beach area,s and will only cost around 15 pounds by taxi from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “don't expect to lounge by the pool”
Reviews.Author: didiIreland
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here as my partner was on business and the location suited us..it is a nice hotel but I wouldn't stay here again. The rooms are very small,breakfast is very expensive(18 euros for continental!)the service in the pool bar is ridiculously slow..45 minutes to bring a caprese salad.But my biggest complaint and the main reason I would never stay here again is that for the size of the hotel there are only 18 sun loungers by the pool..and for my entire stay there was a group Germans who put their towels on the loungers before they went for breakfast meaning that if you got to the pool by 0930 all the loungers are taken,and yes there is a shuttle to the beach but it only goes once at 10am.Not once in the 7 days we were there did I manage to get a lounger..and I wasn't the only one.To me that is just unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected but rooms awfully cluttered”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the view of a far better hotel...the Burj Al Arab! I was surprised as I was not expecting much from a Holiday Inn but the location just a few minutes walk to the Mall of the Emirates is brilliant plus there are some decent eateries just outside on the street. Also being located just a few hundred yards from the metro station can only be a good thing. The room was comfortable enough but I didnt find the outfitting particularly modern and the two small beds were a disappointment. Also you could only see the TV from one of the beds. There was far too much clutter and the room was long and narrow. The bathrooms however were spacious however I did notice an awful lot of hairs all over the showers and floors which suggests to me that it only had a very basic going over by the housekeeping staff before my arrival. I had room service on the morning I arrived and it was acceptable however I would be inclined to go somewhere else for food next time as it was only just standard. Staff were friendly however and very professional. I did wander into the sports bar by the lobby however wandered out soon after as it lacked atmosphere and just seemed to be full of solo travellers bored out of their minds. I briefly sat on a sofa in the lobby to use the free wifi (no wifi in the rooms which in this day and age is shocking considering so many devices nowadays only have wifi connections) and discovered at least a dozen of those little cockroaches living in it so I belted away fairly quickly after that. All in all not a bad experience but also nothing memorable either!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: mbroomhead
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and it was more upmarket than I expected. The room was really nice (I was upgraded) and it is within walking distance to the Mall of the Emirates. Its also just off Sheikh Zayed Road so easy to get to and from. The pool on the roof was clean and all staff were very friendly and capable. I went to the pub in the hotel for dinner, they didn't offer too much in terms of food and I wasn't able to book it to my room but was ok other than that. I arranged a rental car by email before I arrived and there were no problems there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a cheap option”
Reviews.Author: map737
Reviews.Content: Hi Spent eight nights here Jan 2012. Overall - great stay. We got an upgrade on our room on arrival and had a lovely big room on 4th floor. Staff at hotel are pleasant and helpful and check in very fast. There is a pub on site open until 02.00 daily. There is also a Thai restaurant which has received good reviews on T.A. We ate there one night as it was very handy and we did not feel like going out, however, while it was o.k. I think there are probably better choices close by, personally I thought the menu was not great/limited and the desert choice was terrible (sadly!). The hotel is five minutes walk from Mall of Emirates which is a real plus, a safe easy walk even at midnight. There is always a taxi outside the hotel if you want to head further and the metro station is only a short walk away. The main road outside the hotel is always busy so a room at the back is probably best, we were at the side and heard no traffic noise at all. There is free internet access in the lobby, (one printer) and a tour company selling local tours daily beside reception. Maybe shop around on the tours through. There is a small pool and gym on the terrace and the public areas are pleasant. I think this hotel is not a bad choice for wheelchair users, the lift service is good, rooms spacious and there is a ramp at the main door. The only negatives are the price, this is not a cheap option but then I doubt there are many of those in Dubai and also that the cleaning of the room was good but not brillant, the floors could have done with a good mop! We were there in Jan but I had the air conditioning on, I don't do heat well! While it kept our room lovely and cool, I don't think it would have been adequate in the summer months in Dubai, but perhaps they can crank it up then. In summary, great location, helpful, attentive staff and a pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good, but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: Sebastiaan1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2008, it was a nice stay, no comments about that. Just the pricelevel is off the wall, Dubai is nothing special at all but charges insane prices

Reviews.Title: “very good location, elegant rooms, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: k_traveler674
Reviews.Content: the best thing in this hotel is its location, just few minutes from mall of the emirates, metro station which is very useful to go anywhere in dubai without taxi. Also the room was spacious, elegant and clean. Bathroom was very clean and luxirous. Breakfast in small buffet but its not bad. There is a free shuttle to jumaira beach park from the hotel and it was good. I may recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You have the view of burg al arab from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbk225
Reviews.Content: Great location. Steps away from mall of emirates. You can see burg al Arab hotel from the hotel. Minutes away from beaches. Situated between 2 metro stops. Great breakfast.. 90dhs.. But not bad.. Not many restaurants near by.bu the mall has a food court.. Hotel has 3 restaurants and 2 bars.. Clean.. Junior suite was perfect.. Bathroom is clean and spacious ... Free wifi at the lobby and 2 nd floor lobby... No wifi in the room.. Cable only. Front desk staff..courteous .. I was having a rough time with emirates Arline screwing up my vacation plans.. Tanks god I was staying at the holiday inn..there were no stress with my stay... If you are not a priority club member, please sign up ASAP. They treat their prirority club members like Vvip,s... Thanks holiday inn al barssha. And the manager Sohail...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Connecttraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during a business trip in October. I booked an Executive Room and the room size was excellent. The breakfast served at the hotel was good however the croissants not worth trying. The hotel is situated next to Emirates Mall and getting a Taxi is not a problem. A short walk is the metro station. This is my second stay at the hotel and I will be back again. The only drawbacks is the internet is very poor which they really need to improve upon.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: elb0fujairah
Reviews.Content: I have just spend 3 nights at this hotel. My husband and friend was very satisfied. Service ok. Rooms nice and clean. Close to metro station. Breakfast buffe nice. Pool and bar realy good, where can you take a drink with a vue at the skyline? At Holeday INN.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Good Facilities”
Reviews.Author: nishitpande
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Dubai on a pleasure trip and had a pleasant stay at the hotel. The pros and cons of the hotel are listed below: Pros: Courteous Staff, spacious rooms, excellent location (walking distance from metro station and Mall of emirates), good selection of breakfast buffet, helpful travel desk Cons: No view from hotel room windows, slow service for laundry and room service, staff not so fluent in English (mostly south Indian staff) I had a wonderful stay at the hotel and it is quite a reasonable place to be with family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about children in the pool”
Reviews.Author: PriorityClubber
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Holiday Inn Al Barsha and were disappointed that they seem to be allowing local children unsupervised to use the roof top pool. When we have stayed before the pool was a lovely relaxing spot to spend the day but this year it was ruined by noisy children splashing in the pool. The room was still very clean and quiet and with the addition of free Wi-Fi which was a nice surprise. We didn't eat in the hotel as with the Metro just a short walk away you could eat in any of the Malls.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent again”
Reviews.Author: AlfredBr
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Holiday Inn Al Barsha. My first stay convinced me to stay in this hotel again and I have not been disapointed. The staff at reception and concierge is very good, polite and helpful. Breakfast was very busy but the waiters did their best to accomodate everyone and keep smiling. I like their pool on the roof (small but nice). Location is great, just next to the mall of emirates. Overall, this hotel offer a great value money which is not the case for many hotel in Dubai. Well done holiday inn Al Barsha. Keep it up. I will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: ReidCarson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Holiday Inn Al Barsha Dubai on two occasions, both in 2011. The service provided by all the staff in this Holiday Inn is special, it is a Holiday Inn and so one has an expectation of the service that will be received well, prepare to be pleasantly surprised. Every member of staff is polite, welcoming, smiley and willing to make your stay an enjoyable experience. I moved rooms whilst I was on my last stay, there was nothing wrong with the room I was in, the staff moved all my clothes luggage and sundries. I didn't have to do anything, they hung my shirts and suits in the wardrobes, put my toiletries in the bathroom and they did it with a smile and when they said they would. The front desk staff call you by name they welcome you back if you are a previous guest. The food is good as well with a choice of dining from seafood to Indian and a lot more in between. So if you have got to go to Dubai and you don't want to spend a fortune stay at The Holiday Inn Al Barsha, it's 5 star service at a 3 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: rutgersdotter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the end of October and had a great stay. Very friendly staff and always got a warm welcome. Nice breakfast buffet with a lot of variety. Lovely room that was cleaned every day with a change of towels, minibar refill etc. There are a few restaurants surrounding the hotel and I strongly recommend you to visit Meem cafe close to mall of emirates. As a Swede you are quite picky about your coffe but I loved it at this place and the staff here i so nice! The hotel is walking distance to mall of emirates and cost about 15 dirham to got o Jumeirah beach from here with the taxi. Lovely white sandy beach with turqouise water. The hotel has a small but nice and clean pool on the roof top and the bar area on the roof is also great. We had roomservice once and that was good to. I would recommend anyone to choose this hotel for their stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Keith-Carrie
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. I consider this my home when I’m in Dubai because I spend so much time here. The rooms are spacious and well set up, clean and convenient. The internet works all the time and supports Skype and if you actually have a problem with it they will provide support. They offer a Sushi bar, couple other restaurants and sports. The breakfast is offered in yet another restaurant where you will find a variety of food there. It’s a proper breakfast buffet. I order room service here, which is always good but is not really expensive. But if I’m not jet lagged, I eat at the “Food and Drink” ( a mom and pops place) next door. I’ve also conducted and taken part in meeting at the business center where the room were clean and they provided everything thing you would expect out of a conference room including a projector. Transportation is super easy. They have taxi’s waiting outside the door for you basically 24 hours a day, there a rental car place next door and its right next to the Mall of the emirates. Drawbacks: The business center was being remodeled. So I had a difficult time having some documents scanned recently and they wanted to charge me for it. Altogether, this place is super convenient for work and life.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: mikefShropshire
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Holiday Inn's around the world and would say this would be one of the better one's. I had a very early flight in so arrived at the hotel early hoping but not expecting a room. The service I recieved was excellent all staff tried very hard to accomodate us and a room was ready within an hour well before check in time. Even when we got into our room we had a call from the desk asking if our room was alright. Large room on the curve of the building which was clean and tidy, large excellent bathroom with nice toiletries, Bed very comfortable and had no problems sleeping 8+ hours a night. Throughout our stay calls to our room with top ups of anything we needed. All staff from service desk to bar,restaurant, security etc where all pleasant and helpfull and we felt very comfortable here. Position of hotel is easy to get to with metro only a few hundred metres away which can take you to most places you need to get to on a short break. Travelled from airport straight here which was about 8AED. Nice pool on roof with views of 6 lane traffic but see beyond that is the Burj Al Arab, Burj Khalifa and in the distance the Atlantis. I would certainly return to this hotel for value and hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Freat Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ncholas-CYP
Reviews.Content: Just came back form a ten day trip in Dubai where I stayed for another time at Barsha Holiday inn. As a frequent business traveller I go to Dubai often for long business trips and till now I tried many places. Holiday Inn is the ideal place for me and that was my third time there. The main reasons for my excellent stay are the below: Room-which had an adeqaue size, very clean with big clean bathroom. More important was also the sleep quality..As a light sleeper I usually have problems because of the noise but at holiday inn i ve never had such a problem. Dining- The hotel has a numbEr of restaurants with excellent food. Both Lebanese and Asian restaurants were my favorites. The hotel had also some theme nights for dining and I tried both Mexican and Italian. Both choices were really good with delicious food at very reasonable price...if I rememebr well it was around 120 AED with unlimited drinks (alcoholic too). Gym-Although small it is well equiped with caring staff. Location-excellent location at new Dubai area between two metro stations. Mall of the emirates is also 5 minutes walk away from the hotel which is like an oasis in the hot and humid weather of dubai. I would definetley stay again at Barsha Holiday Inn and I strongly recommend it to other travellers too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice on the outside, but mouldy in the middle”
Reviews.Author: TKOR2011
Reviews.Content: check in was painless and we recieved a nice upgraded room and a complimentary chocolate cake! Everything was pretty good, clean and good air-con with a decent sized room. It is a litle bit far away from places you would want to go - like the Dubai Mall and souks, but taxis are cheap and always available. Over the few days that we where there, we found the service to be lacking. Items that where supposed to be in our room, like an iron and ironing board, and international converter where not. we asked for a international converter and housekeeping said they would bring us one, but it never arrived. We also asked at the front desk if they would mind calling a tour company we had booked through to confirm our booking - they refused to do this as they had an affiliation with another tour company. That is just ridiculous! we asked them to book a "regular" taxi for us to take us to the airport, but they tried very hard to get us to take one of the hotel taxis (a lot more expensive). If we had wanted a hotel taxi then I would of said that. The swimming pool on the roof is very small, but adequate. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you are in town for a couple of days, just dont expect great service.

Reviews.Title: “not an exclusive Dubai hotel”
Reviews.Content: hotel is clean, swimming pool on roof, bar on roof for sun downers, noisy as next to main road. rooms ok, tea/coffee, flatscreen tele, but room I had looked out onto a block of offices, no view whats so ever and could not really open your curtains. Food ok, wi-fi in the rooms is a terrible connection. The hotel is 10 mins walk from one of the biggest malls in dubai with the indoor ski centre next door. shopping if its your bag is good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah D
Reviews.Content: I am only back from a 4 night stay in this hotel with my sister in law . The staff in this hotel were extremley Courteous from the moment we stepped into the hotel until we left the staff could not do enough for you and were also extremley welcoming. I have never Experienced such excellent customer service in any other hotel we have stayed in . Holiday Inn should be very proud of all the staff from the Concierge , Reception , Cleaners and restaurent / bar staff they all made our stay a very Pleasurable experience . The location of the hotel is perfect it is a short taxi journey from anywhere you want to visit in Dubai. Our room was perfect , very clean beds changed daily along with towels also . A good size also and very modern . There is also a shuttle bus that will take you to the beach or to the Dubai outlet mall which we found very handy . It is a 5 min walk to the Mall of the Emirates and also a 2 min walk to the Metro station which will also take you to the Dubai Mall . We are very pleased with out choice of hotel and will be recommending this hotel to anyone that we know traveling to Dubai . Well done Holiday Inn Al Barsha , we hope to stay with you again in the Future .

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, somewhat tired”
Reviews.Author: DPALTON
Reviews.Content: Business in Dubai seems to be conducted on or about the 14 lane motorway that passes straight through the middle of town and which is parallel to the beach. The Holiday Inn is close to the Emirates Mall and fronting a service road which abuts and then joins the main highway. There is also a Metro station nearby. The metro is very clean and efficient. So, the Hotel is very convenient for doing business and is not especially noisy. The breakfasts are good, the evening meals fell short of the best standards. The Kempinski in the Mall has better restaurant food at more or less the same price. The rooms are big enough and clean. The staff are helpful and courteous. The décor and carpets are past their best and there is an atmosphere of lassitude and commercial tiredness that is immediately recognisable but difficult to define. The internet service is very poor - its pay for cable or try to hook onto a service in the lounge. Not good enough. I would stay there again but there are better hotels that offer better value

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, under quality”
Reviews.Author: CISSPUK
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Holiday Inn, cheap service aimed at the business market. The standard rooms are very small, one might even say cramped, but then I should have guessed that when (upon arrival) they instantly tried to sell me an upgrade. It's at the point of check-in that they make it very clear that for the price you don't get any extras (internet access, breakfast etc.) Housekeeping is highly variable, from fully cleaned through to "I can only be bothered to make the bed" Be careful if you need a taxi, like many other hotels they push the hotel taxi service hard, but these are about twice the price of the local, metered cabs. All in all, OK(ish), better to use the Radison Blue.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average”
Reviews.Author: makeminealargeone
Reviews.Content: A good hotel - deserves 3 and a half stars really. Rooms are pleasant - mine overlooked the atrium so I didn't hear doors slamming like I would, had there been a room opposite me. The bed is comfortable - I love the firm mattress. There is free wifi in the lobby but not in the room, although there is a cable for your laptop. There are also some computers you can use in the lobby - just ask reception for a code. The gym and pool are on the rooftop - great views of the city and the Burj al Arab hotel.The gym is alright for a hotel gym. The Mall of the Emirates is 5 minutes walk away and there is a metro stop very close by. Staff are pleasant - I find this to be the case in most hotels in the Middle East. The hotel isn't right in the centre of town but it would only take 5-10 minutes in a car. The beach is pretty close by too and Wild Wadi, the water park is definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but would prefer a different one in S. Zayed Rd”
Reviews.Author: Mitch_Bal
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here last year to celebrate a friend's birthday. The interior of the hotel is good compared to other Holiday Inns. Lots of constructions ongoing in the area. You would always needs a taxi to get to the hotel or you can take the train and walk around 5 mins which is not a good idea with the country's scorching heat during daytime . The pool on the roof top is quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Great A/C, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: pekopper
Reviews.Content: This is one of the more "plain" hotels in Dubai. A/C in the rooms will freeze you out, which says a lot! Beds are comfortable. Resturant leaves a bit to be desired. I've stayed at the Marriott, Travelors, Sherraton 4 Points too. Those properties have nicer facilities and resturants, but this Holiday Inn compares with the rooms and it's furnishings. But sadly, not the resturant. Consider the Marriott a "10", 4 Points is a "6", "Travelors" is a "5" and the Holliday Inn is a "1.5". Sorry Holliday...

Reviews.Title: “A good 4*”
Reviews.Author: Crisp47
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just a couple of nights for a stopover on our way to Thailand. Was generally surprised at the quality of the hotel for a Holiday Inn at the price we paid. Good location 20 minutes or so from the airport, 5 minutes walk from mall of the emirates and a couple of minutes walk to 2 metro stations. Rooms were a reasonable size and generally decorated to a good standard, though the bath had seen better days. Lobby/restaurant was nicely decorated, made a nice change for a chain hotel. If you book a taxi from the concierge make sure you ask to pay cash and only pay what a taxi would cost as you'll end up with the hotel car. Overall good value and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No wifi in room!”
Reviews.Author: Captiv8matt
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times. Staff are great and service is good. The nasi goreng rocks! But In this day and age, a hotel HAS to have wifi in the rooms! We're passed Ethernet! I get wifi in Accra! Dubai should be way ahead! And this hotel needs to update it's capabilities!

Reviews.Title: “5-Star at 4-Star Price”
Reviews.Author: tomf104
Reviews.Content: My second stay and was not disappointed at my choice. The open atrium and glass elevators definitely give you the feel that you are staying in a 5-star but the price is quite reasonalble. Although the overall service was not on par with the Crown Plaza Deira my executive room was outstanding. Room service was very good and the Gem Garden breakfast buffet was outstanding, the "Q" Bar had a great neighborhood atmosphere with great pub food. The hotel is only a block from the Mall of the Emirates which is one of the primary reasons for choosing this Holiday Inn. It is about 20-25 minutes from DXB which was an issue for me. Will definitely stay a third time when in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: romaniuk1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Holiday Inn for 4 nights in July 2011. t's located just 5min walk from Mall of the Emirates. There are several restaurants on ground level, and swimming pool on the roof. Staff is friendly, but hotel needs renowation. Rooms are relativelly small (European size) comparing to other hotels in Dubai and room's doors don't separate comfortably from corridor's noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay on business”
Reviews.Author: Saxon912
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an executive room, which was clean, spacious and well appointed. The hotel staff are extremely helpful and polite. The food is good but on the expensive side (120 aed for 4 small plates of sushi) and the beer in the rather smoky Q bar is very pricy. Taxis are usually plentiful outside the hotel, but always go for an official cab, as touts in private cars will try to hustle you and you end up paying about 25% more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Gauravramchandani
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated, perfect for the business traveler, breakfast was good enough. Staff was very pleasant. The rooms were clean and well maintained. Rooms are enabled with wi-fi facilities, we had an extremely plesent stay, and would surely stay in this hotel in the future

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but some cons”
Reviews.Author: HJB93
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located out of the city centre. It is about 20 - 25 minutes driving from the airport with a taxi (~65 - 85 AED; depending on taxi and time (day/night)). The Mall of the Emirates is around the corner of the hotel, which is a big plus. The Dubai Metro runs in front of the hotel as well as the Sheikh Zayed Highway. The closest Metrostation is the Sharaf DG Station which is located to the left of the hotel, the other station is the Mall of the Emirates station which is located to the right side of the hotel. You could buy a Silver Nol (20 AED including 14 AED credit; cannot be returned after use), a Red Nol (don't know the price, but you can make ten journeys) or seperate tickets for the Dubai Metro. The location of the hotel is ideal because it's close to the Dubai Metro which you can use to explore the whole city. You must be aware of the fact that the red line is still the only line which has opened of the Dubai Metro, the Green Line will open around September 2011. One extra tip, watch out with asking for a taxi to the concierge, we've expercienced that he gave us a quite expensive Lexus-taxi whitout meter. So, arrange a taxi by yourself, there are always taxi's at the front of the hotel. The hotel also provides a Shuttle Bus, I don't know the exact destination. The arrival at the hotel was very good, we arrived at night and upon arrival we've got a welcome drink and a wet towel. Check in was very fast and well organized. The lobby is not really big, but it is okay, it is located in the atrium of the hotel, which is really nice. The hotel has 7 restaurants, which is a lot for such a hotel. We eat in neither of them because it was quite expensive (breakfast: 90 AED), the shopping malls have cheap foodcourts, which are quite good. We had a nice bellboy, who talked to us for twenty minutes after delivering our suitcases, he was very kind so this is a plus for the hotel. We booked an executive room with an extra bed, there was no breakfast included, this is a drawback because it usualy is included at an executive room. At arrival the room was completely prepared, except the extra bed. But the houskeeping installed it very quick. The room was realy huge, it is the hugest hotelroom I've ever stayed in. There was one big kingbed, two armchairs and two desks. There was a lot of space in the hotelroom, which we really appriciated. The hotelroom was a bit in Middle East Style with some elements from the Middle East, such as lamps. The view from the hotelroom was at the Dubai Metro, Sheikh Zayed Road and the Burj Al Arab. It's easy to see that the hotel is a little bit older, there are dark lines at the ceilings and the airconditioning is dirty and old. High-speed internet is available in the room, it is available with wire but also wireless. The connection with wire was complementairy (it said (although the service guide said that it was available for a fee); executive room). The bathroom of the room was, in comparison to the hotelroom, quite small. There was a toilet, a bidet, a sink with mirror and a bath with shower. The bathroom was the main disappointment of this hotel and looked at some points quite old. When we showered the water flowed along the side of the bath to the floor, the result was a wet floor every time we showered. I consider this as a major drawback. Another light flaw was that the towelrack was not firmly attatched to the wall and it hung as it could fall at any moment. Housekeeping is very good, when we asked for an extra blanket, mug and towel they gave it us immediately. This was the same when we asked for an iron. The rooms are cleaned good as well. Good service! Check out was really fast as well. We had a late check-out (2:00 pm) which is available at request, after 2:00 pm you pay half of the room rate. After checkout we experciened one more con, we studied the bill closely in the taxi to the airport and discovered a subject a the bill where we couldn't exactly determine of where it was charged for. At the airport we've sent an email to the hotel, but they don't reply after multiple tries at the email. The have read the email but they don't reply. Due to this fact I conclude that the aftersalesservice is quite bad. Now I've sent an email to Holiday Inn Customer Care and not to the hotel, I hope that they can solve it. There is a gym and rooftop pool at the hotel, but due to the weather it is way to hot to swim in the pool. The overall performance of this hotel is good and unless the disadvantages I would recommend this hotel to a friend. Pro's: + Fast check-in and -out + Nice staff and service + Nice view; + Free Highspeed Internet + Very close to the Dubai Metro (red line) + Very Close to Mall of the Emirates Con's: - No breakfast at executive room rate - Quite old, mostly the bathroom. - Bathroom is small compared to room - Poor aftersales

Reviews.Title: “Great place to recouperate during a stop over”
Reviews.Author: Tez from Oz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped for one night on the way to europe for Australia. We booked direct with the Hotel and they were kind enough to have our room ready to check in at 0600 and only charged one night. The room was small but clean and comfortable and the breakfast fantastic. The mall of Emirates is only 5 mins walk but in 44 degrees C heat it felt like half an hour. Would definitely stay again on my way through dubai

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Avocat1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and thought the hotel was fantastic!! Its only 4 star but the rooms and service are top notch. Far better than any 4 star hotel you would stay in in New Zealand, Australia or the US. And the hotel restaurant downstairs was amazing. Excellant food and precision service. And the best hot chocolate we've ever had! Well located next the Emirates Mall and also has a fantastic roof top pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: SandeePriyanka
Reviews.Content: Gharana, Indian Restaurant is tired place to have food. We went to have food with family. food is good. service is slow. we didn't even finish the food and plates were taken off. seems staff was in hurry to go home. Good promotion, good food but service is a big question mark. Another thing about singers. taking long break when customers are there to enjoy. If song is not available no one offers second option. Well, need to think twice before visit them again.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfying”
Reviews.Author: Croatia_ZG
Reviews.Content: Hotel Holiday Inn Al Barsha is a good 4* hotel. It is located very close (within walking distance) to Emirates Mall & Kempinski hotel. Lets start from below... reception very nice, on your right hand side while on the left hand side you will find a nice lobby with restaurant serving beautiful breakfast. In fact, it is one of favourite breakfasts. Check in & check out were really quickly both times i stayed there. Rooms were nice, i even got the upgrade to a room with Burj view. Beds were particulary nice to sleep in. Considering that hotel is about 3 years old, rooms are still ok and in a good shape. Pool area, which is on the last floor is little bit small and it is hard to find a spot for yourself during the day. There's a snack bar by the pool, which is really nice in the evening because of the Burj al Arab view. It is a little bit out of town centre but, what is the centre in Dubai?? BY taxi it is some 15 minutes from the Creek area. Trust me, if you're looking for a 4* hotel, then book Holiday Inn Al Barsha. Price you'll pay for it is pretty much ok, so you wont fee robbed lilke in some other hotels in UAE. It is close to Emirates mall, the Palm area, Marina is also not too far, hotel reasonably new and in good shape, breakfast excellent... What else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - excellent staff - Unbelievable value for money”
Reviews.Author: Marcvg
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have stayed at this hotel. I don't understand why it is a Holiday Inn as it is easily 5 star. It has the friendliest staff of any hotel I have stayed in, in Dubai. Noone can do enough for you. The choice of restaurants is amazing - and the food was fantastic. The rooftop pool is amazing and the gym very well equipped Also extremely good value for money. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “quality accomodation”
Reviews.Author: hunkydories
Reviews.Content: Really good for business travelers. Rooms are decorated well, large enough. Lively small but very clean swimming pool at the top of the bulding. It has full panaromic view of Indian Ocean. It has free parking garage. Busiess center and fitness center are good as well. But some of the rooms look inside of the hotel lobby, thus they have no view. Actually they are ok, but after 2 days it is become boring to stay at a room which has hotel lobby view. Get remark in your booking before c/i to the hotel to do not stay at these rooms. By the way walking distance to Mall of the Emirates and easy acess to metro to reach wtc and Dubai Mall.

Reviews.Title: “great location to mall of emirates”
Reviews.Author: swampee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights on our way back to Perth (Aust) after a short holiday in the UK visiting family. We booked through expedia and arrived at the hotel about 1.30am. Booking was extemely quick and we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite on the 4th floor, a lovely surprise! Very clean room and extremely quiet. We heard nothing until about 10am when we were woken up with somebody knocking gently on our door to service the room. It is only a short walk (5-10min) to the mall of emirates, a large selection of cafes for breakfast. We did try a local restaurant next to the hotel one morning and the food was very nice. Staff were very polite at both bars, the sports bar was quite noisy and very smokey so we ended up have drinks in the cocktail bar. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Total Value for Money & Excellently Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shaang99
Reviews.Content: I got a chance to stay in this Hotel for a training program that I attended in January 2011 through my company - Honeywell ME. Hotel location is excellent, the staff was very friendly, Hotel rooms were very clean and well maintained & there was an Indian restaurant also available, so no problems of food also!! All in all, a total value for money.

Reviews.Title: “a very sweet girl”
Reviews.Author: KamalAlBadr
Reviews.Content: my name is Kamal Al Badr, i am from Kuwait. I came to visit Dubai with friends.. I called the hotel and an Arabic sweet girl answered me, I asked her about the location, she explained to me how to reach the hotel. Then i asked her if there is an Italian restaurant, she said to me: "Unfortunately sir, we don't have but we do have an international cuisine called Gem Garden, tonight and every Sunday, we have Italian night and it's very delicious.. If you like i'll transfer you to restaurant reservation to book for you" ... I laugh & i tolled her no problem, i'll try it today" I found the hotel very easily, i came with 3 of my friends, i had the dinner. I just loved it.. The service is okay, specially the Indian guy, Nanda, he serve us the best way he can. We finished our dinner. I approach reception, i asked about her. She came out smiling, greeted us in a very friendly - cheerful way. She has a difficult name (Voilah) I thanked her for the good advice about the restaurant and the right direction. what a lovely and a helpful lady.. Every hotel should have employees like her, she is a great example, truly.. Before i leave, she explain to me about the other night that hey have & Invited me to come again,, So thank you Voilah for your help, for sure i will come again to Holiday Inn Al Barsha, because of these sweet people who they working there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: misterclancy
Reviews.Content: To begin, we travel 1/3 of the year, and in dozens of hotels during my trips. We only use this hotel during our 2-3 trips per year to Dubai. The price and quality of the hotel are perfect. It's very close to all of the locations I frequent, which means the taxi rides are not expensive. Taxi's conveniently tend to be outside at almost all times. The metro is a 5 min walk away, and very cheap to ride. As for the amenities, there are several hotel restaurants that we use, and the food is fantastic! While the breakfast buffet is great, it still is a bit pricey. The roof top pool is small, but adequate for a little bit of early sun. There is a spot on the roof for drinks/food/shisha, which is nice in the evenings. Staff is great and friendly. Our favorite is Madame Fumi from the sushi bar! They just changed tour companies working in the lobby, but I'm sure it's similar with the old one, which was good. No free wifi at the hotel. If you drink, best to buy your duty free on ARRIVAL. All alcohol is expensive in Dubai, so it may save a bit if you bring it. The rooms have a fridge that will easily hold a case of beer :-) I very much recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Stewartmac1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week beginning 27/03/11. I was with my wife & another couple. We had a 2 bedroom suite. The rooms were very comfortable & clean. The bed was really comfortable with a choice of pillows. Our rooms were at the back of the hotel on the 6th floor & very quiet. The only noise we experienced was with workmen going up the outside of the building in a cradle one morning, however being at 9am it was not much of a problem. The only negative re. our rooms is that the air conditioning for the bedrooms is set via one controller, therefore both bedrooms will be at the same setting regardless. The lounge area has it's own controller. All the staff we had contact with from front desk to housekeeping were efficient, friendly & helpful. The laundry service was quick & reasonably priced. I must also mention that unknowingly I sent my jeans down to the laundry with 600 AED in my pocket. Within 5 mins I had a call from housekeeping & the money was quickly returned....top marks for honesty! The pool was busy during our stay & there never seemed to be enough sunloungers, however given the limited space I suppose this is understandable. We still thought that another 6 beds could have been fitted in. The waiting staff at the pool bar vary rarely make it upstairs to the pool area, so if you require anything it's quicker to go down & order it yourself. Special mention must be given to the lifeguard on duty who always had a smile & ensured that when a lounger did become available it was positioned where required very swiftly. The hotel is reasonably well positioned for most of the attractions you will want to see in Dubai. The Al Barsha Metro is 2 minutes walk across the road & this coupled with the cheap & plentiful taxis made travelling around very easy. The Mall Of The Emirates is an easy 5 minute walk from the hotel & is an amazing place to visit If shopping is your thing or if you need to merely visit the supermarket (Carrefour.) The array of shops is simply stunning. It's also the venue for Ski Dubai. The food court caters to every taste & is reasonably priced. Tip: if walking to the Mall take care on the zebra-crossing that is situated on the bend, especially on your return journey as it's a bit of a blind corner. Not all drivers stop at pedestrian crossings! My wife in particular was worried about the dress code in Dubai as we had never visited before. I would say now that there is no need for concern. You will see every style of dress in the Malls, most appropriate & some not so. We even saw a woman wearing a thong on Jumeira Beach which we thought would be a complete no-no! In the evening dress as you would normally for a night out at home, use common sense & you'll be fine. Tip: as all the bars are situated in hotels, most of the smart high end hotels frown against guys wearing shorts/trainers in the evening. Restaurants such as Trader Vics will not permit this either. To summarise: we had a fabulous trip & The Holiday Inn Al Barsha made for a great base from which to explore all the wonderful things that Dubai has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip with some free time !”
Reviews.Author: Karen M
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at 2.30am. Reception staff checked me in with no hiccups. My room was on the 4th Floor - looking in to the main lobby. Room was of an ample size for 1 person - choice of pillows, ample size bathroom with excellent shower. Ordered food from Room Service during my stay. The food & service was excellent. Great location for visiting Mall of Emerates. Taxis and Towncars available outside Hotel. Only 2 downsides to this hotel. 1. No chance of a long lie - corridors are noisy in the mornings with the domestic workers. 2. Non-smoking rooms unavailable.

Reviews.Title: “not really impressed”
Reviews.Author: AlenKa1010
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at the hotel for 1 night due to some works going on at the house and was not impressed. i mean , the stay was OK, but there were couple of things to be fixed. no non-smoking rooms was the major disappointment, as everything from the elevator to the coridor to the room to the bed sheets stinked tobacco and housekeeping efforts would have not helped (if they did arrive indeed as was promised). secondly house-keeping itslef was quite unprofessional trying to enter my room in the middle of the night under the pretence of bringing me the pillow when i have actually been expecting the call regarding their pillow menu (nobody called, obviously, and they don't know what is firm and what is non-allergenic). mini-bar was empty and I had to pay for the room-service directly with cash, no room charges... otherwise it's good location and can be a good spot for business travellers who don't mind smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: chandler8528
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Holiday Inn Al Barsha a few times in the past 6 months and each of those stays have been very comfortable. The staff have been amongst the hospitable i have come across. The Hotel is some distance away from the heart of the city. It however is ideal if your work is near the Al Qous Industrial area or in Jebel Ali. It is also a great place for tourists as The Dubai Marina and Jumeriah are just 10 mins away. Also, the Mall of the Emirates is a stone's throw away from the hotel. You can get taxis from the hotel at anytime during the day. I personally have got cabs immediately even at 2 in the morning! The rooms are top notch and the room service is very adept. While the food that is served at the breakfast buffet is very good, the prices of food for room service is a tad expensive. During my last trip, we made use of the conference room in the Hotel and these are ideal for a meet of 7-10 people. The hotel had separate wifi connectivity for each conference room. The hotel is slightly more expensive than the others nearby but in terms of quality of service, it rises way above the rest.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: deadwing
Reviews.Content: I wanted a cheap hotel in central Dubai, this fitted the bill. I put previous experience of Holiday Inns around the world to one side. Walking distance to the mall, big room, good service, quiet. Only downside was the expensive breakfasts and internet charges on top.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: TomBB6472
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. I use Holiday Inn hotels in other countries when travelling for business and I must say this is one of the best if not the best Holiday Inn I have ever been at. The best asset of this hotel is their staff. All are all polite, friendly and very helpful. The room was nice and clean. The bed is extremly comfortable. Breakfast is very good. I will definitely use this hotel every time I travel to Dubai for business.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and business friendly”
Reviews.Author: Dagarwal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times in the last 2 years and have found it very functional and conveniently located, near the Metro station. The Wi-Fi speed is good and the choice of food options is great! Can be more value for money if the rates were 10-15% lower

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Good ,but Noisy and Far from City Center”
Reviews.Author: Farshad74
Reviews.Content: Clean and Good ,but Noisy and Far from City Center I was in this hotel from 17 to 19 Feb for a business trip. Positive: 1- Clean and Good Quality compare to Price 2- Good Breakfast 3- 1 Minute walk to Metro ( Sharaf DG or AL barsha ) 4- Good View from the Pool to Burj al arab 5- Good Front Desk Staff and Respectful to All ( Mr. Fareed from Egypt ( who told me some Arabic words to Learn ;) ,Mr. Usaid = who gave me the good room ,Mr. Stephan& Mrs. Olga who called the airport staff to check my Flight and All Breakfast Team who arranged a good Place and English Breakfast Tea ) 6- Good Food in the Resto (however Expensive 120 AED and 30 AED fresh Orange) 7- Good Airport Transportation ( Again Expensive = 120 AED !!!!!!for a 1 Person in a Lexus and Luxury Car ) 8- Good pool and Gym Negative: 1- Noisy room ( rooms beside Sheykh zayed highway are not good ) 2- Far from Attraction in Dubai and far from city 3- bad Busiesss Center : In Business center ,there are a lot of Smoke of smoking ,noisy and you can not Easily Check Internet as it is not Quite ( the Business Center located inside a Bar !!!) the price also is 30 AED for 1 hour ! the spees was average -Finally: Ask them to give a quite room in the back to have good sleep Quality . -Choose the metro from Airport and also from Hotel to Airport which is around 10 AED and do not use Hotel Cars which are really Expensive .the metro is safe and clean -you can find everything in Mall of Emirates and also Carrefour Supermarket .do not choose Marina Mall and Waitrose Supermarket which are really expensive - choose Dubai Big bus in the Airport to see all Dubai Area for a good price - taxi price is normal compare to Europe in the Area I recommend this hotel compare to Price and other Holiday Inn .

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with a great location for combining business and sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: SDavies1961
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip which I combined with a weekend stopover for sightseeing/meeting up with friends. Staff were polite from the moment I arrived until my departure 7 days later. There are a number of restaurants in the hotel which all provided good food and good service. The roof top pool is relaxing and almost empty first thing in the morning and early evenings.Sauna and steam room available too. Room quality was good, and cleaned well, the bed was very comfortable. I didn't feel comfortable walking into the bar on my own as it was frequented by 'ladies of the night' fortunately I was staying at the hotel with colleeagues so did not have to sit alone but females travelling alone avoid the bar! There is a lovely roof top bar that I thoroughly recommed with lovely views across Dubai..Also very convenient hotel if you need to get about as it is a 5 minute walk to the very efficient Dubai metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy adjoining room”
Reviews.Author: FossFoss
Reviews.Content: Most things are satisfactory with this hotel. Staff is generally friendly except for reception desk staff who are a bit sullen. In room internet is not included but chargeable at quite high fee. Just make sure you do not get a room which is one of two adjoining rooms. The noise from next door came right through the closed adjoining doors and our neighbour turned on his TV before 6 am every morning! We picked this hotel for its location close to the Mall of the Emirates but there may be other ones closer for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: maggieliverpool
Reviews.Content: well... the beds are comfortable but do not go if you wish to spend time by the pool, its very hard to get a sunbed! Most of the staff are friendly but I would exclude the duty manager and reservations - bar and restaurant staff lovely. On arriving and being a holiday inn platinum holder, requested an up-grade and we were told none available but would be a 3.00 the next day. As requested we went to reception in the morning and told to go back to room at 3 and wait for a call and in the meantime my friend visited reception again to confirm, as we had spent our time waiting to unpack. But no room, which was ok as standard rooms are good, but my biggest issue was with the duty managers who in my opinion treated us with disdain, 'who had we spoken to? when did we speak to them? it was as if he thought it was a figment of my imagination!. Positively, he did throw in breakfast. Location good but watch the ladies of the night in the sports bar whose numbers grew over the week. Must be a service for the business men. Not very comfortable sat in a bar surrounded by these women! Thai restaurant is beautiful and staff the best in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service and system but good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Henry1999
Reviews.Content: I flew from Bangkok to Dubai and it is about 11 pm there but we didn't get the room. Because the room is not finished cleaning yet but they should prepare for us before we check-in. They said the guests that stayed in our room won't get out before the check-out time. We got a room when it was already half past midnight. Since we entered the room, the bathroom amenties weren't ready. They were no shampoos, shower gel and even towel for shower. We told the housekeeping so they refilled SOME for us. The next day when we came back from trip. The amenties are still not ready! The towels are still only one. But I like the hotel's breakfast very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: KMnME
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exceptionally good for its rates. Stiff would go an extra mile to help u, and the hotel is very clean. The rooms are the best, very well furnished, and the rooms are pretty big and with very comfortable beds. We didnt try any food there. The location is really good. you would be 5 mins away from Emirates mall, which is a really big shopping mall, with great food courts, cinemas, and Dubai Ski. It's actually a walkable distance, IF u can take the weather :) but the taxis are always available.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: hassanScott
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, though breakfast is expensive (DH90 per person). It is such a long way from the airport however relative to some other hotels, that this might not be the best choice unless you want to be near mall of the emirates or Burj Arab area. The walk to the mall is not bad, but in the summer would feel like a long way.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: josieDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: Terrific Staff ,in paticular Partha ,who when he saw 2 seniors struggling with bags ,alway's seemed to appear and whisk them up to our room.Small pool but really cosy area ,fab comfortable sunbed's. Room service excellent ,Bed's and pillow'a very comfortable,only minus we got towel's twice that had hole's in them.A very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Jo_williamsMuscat
Reviews.Content: I'm a tough cookie to make happy and the Holiday Inn at Al Barsha managed it in bucket loads. The front reception desk blows the likes of their local neighbours/IBIS out of the water and could give hotel chains like the Sofitel a run for their money. The rooms were pleasantly decorated, bathrooms were a great size and the facilities provided for my young niece (9 months old) were more than adequate. Nothing was too much trouble and I would highly recommend the Thai restaurant. The food was superb. Why not 5/5 stars? If you fancy a drink on the rooftop bar be warned of a long and somewhat frustrating wait! It might do the hotel management the world of good to enrol their waiting staff onto English language course if they wish them to take orders every day/night. That's my only negative point, and it cant be that bad if I've already booked my next stay! Well done the team.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel and disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: therankster
Reviews.Content: Would probably be better as a business hotel rather than leisure. We stayed in a room over looking the inner atrium. This was a bit noisy but to be fair it was a holiday weeked in UAE. Compared to our previous hotel the Pullman down the road this hotel I'm afraid does not come close to a 4 star. Reasons are quality and standard of service are way above the Holiday Inn. Did notice a lady of the night propositioning a man leaving the hotel when we were arriving back at about 9.30pm outside the reception area, which you don't realy want to hear on your hols.

Reviews.Title: “We'd Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: Abanazar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for eleven nights and other groups of friends stayed up to seven nights for our daughter's wedding held at Christ Church, Jebel Ali, Dubai and Al Qasr Hotel complex. We'd booked an executive room incl. breakfast. The room was massive with all the usual facilities, incl. iron & ironing board (a necesssity in the circumstances). Other smaller rooms seemed to have similar facilities excl. the ironing stuff, fluffy slippers and dressing gowns. Free water every day. Breakfast was more than adequate with good and slightly changing selection. The only time we attempted to stay in for an evening meal, at the Gem Garden, one of about four eateries, they'd no beef, they'd no lamb, so they'd no customers and we went elsewhere. The hotel's position is pretty central in newer Dubai, and just five minutes careful walk to Mall of the Emirates, the one with Ski Dubai, where there are a whole host of eating places, most very good and not overly priced. It's also close enough to the Metro to be useful, (non of the beach hotels are close enough to the Metro). A trip from Mall of the Emirates Station to the airport takes 40 minutes, but trains do not run during the night, so check first. However the closest/easiest station to the hotel is Sharaf DG, not the Mall of the Emirates station! Sharaf DG is the next station. You can easily get to the Marina on the Metro for an evening meal or visit the Dubai Mall & Burj Khalifa (about 4 metro stops plus a 15 minute walk at the other end, in the sun). A trip up the Burj K is well worth doing - it's about 100Dhs if you book and pay online or by phone a day or more in advance, but it's 4 times as much if you just turn up, The spacious almost totally enclosed viewing area is on the 124th floor and you hardly feel the lift move (in fact they've installed arrow lights in the walls to help give the impression of movement). I timed it coming down and it took just one minute and eight seconds! Impressive and not at all scary. The hotel also has a supply of it's own and normal taxis outside (compare prices) and it's own mini bus holding up to about 20 for larger groups. Taxis are the main way of getting from a to b in Dubai, so expect to use them. They're quite cheap especially if there's 3 or 4 of you, but it helps to have a clue where you're going and what else is nearby. Never expect to go the same way to anywhere twice! We've been ten times now and the roads are noticeably quieter than two years ago although busy at times. Best recommendation for actually seeing the bulk of Dubai in an informative way is to book a two consecutive day Big Bus Tour ticket - do the beach tour one day and the city tour the next (you get free entry in to the Dubai Museum which is well worth a visit and is mostly air-conditioned and underground and you can also build in a free one hour dhow cruise on the Creek). The tours are hop on, hop off as you want, with a recorded commentary. In an evening go to the hotel's roof top bar area (it's near the rooftop pool), enjoy the warm evening air in an Arabian style setting, and try a shisha for a laugh. You'll hear the metro trains and the traffic on Sheikh Zayed Road but it's not really a problem, in fact it's fascinating watching it all. We've tried various hotels in Dubai over the years and to be honest they've all been more than acceptable. This Holiday Inn is a match for any of them and, certainly for us, was in a better postion than most - not because it's by anything in particular except Mall of the Emirates, but that it's easy to get to other places from here by taxi without it costing too much.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: My second time here and I looked forward to returning. From the airport it is a fairly easy drive and a warm welcome was waiting on my arrival. The hotel is situated right by a main highway and so would not be good for holidaymakers. Also, the views from the windows are not great as construction is going on all around. The pool is on the roof terrace and so can hardly be called peaceful. Despite these issues for business it is in a great location, the internet (wired) is free in the rooms. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and well equipped and the service is great. The advantage of having the Mall of the Emirates within short walking distance is also a great bonus. This hotel must be one of the world's best Holiday Inns. I would not advise it for leisure travellers but would give it the thumbs up for business.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL -GREAT LOCATION FOR THE MALL OF EMIRATES”
Reviews.Author: ROULA-THANOS
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in the Hotel at the beg of July for 2 days for our overning in Dubai. Although we arrrived early a.m the hotel offered us an early check in which was much appreciated, especially as we had with us our little baby. The lobby of the hotel is big and very nice decorated. Our rooms was big and nice decorated. Although it was facing the main road we did not had any noise. We booked this hotel in order to visit the nearby Mall of Emirates which is less than 5mns on foot. Same was very convenient. Ending it was a good selection and we do recomend it to other as it is also value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable and plenty of feacilities”
Reviews.Author: SCDC2620
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn as it was close to the office for work. For leisure traveller's this hotel is close (500m) to the Mall of the Emirates and Ski Dubai. The hotel is also a short cab ride to the Palm Jumera, Burj Al Arab and Jurmeriah Beach. A 50AED cab ride will take you to Old Dubai and the Gold, Purfume and Spice Souks. A metro station is also located at the Mall of the Emirates that will take you into the centre of Dubai. The staff at the HI were extremely helpful, giving assistance or advice whenever required. The rooms were comfortable and well maintained. I chose the Business Package which included breakfast and unlimited internet connectivity. The internet connection was fast and trouble free. The hotel also has 5 resturants covering traditional Middle Eastern, European, Thai fare and a Sushi Bar. Most tastes would be covered in the HI complex.

Reviews.Title: “Everything good!”
Reviews.Author: doctorpk007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night. Booked a Standard room but were upgraded to an Executive room on the 3rd floor. Nice hotel with a great atrium wing. Fast lifts, courteous staff and fast reception. Located on main Sheikh Zayed Road and is a 10 minute walk or 5 minute taxi ride to the Mall of Emirates. The metro goes past this hotel, however the station which is 2-3 minutes walk from the hotel is not operational as yet. Tastefully appointed rooms with very comfy bed. Big LCD TV, safe, ironing board, robes (no slippers though) complimentary tea/ coffee and also free internet (which we never used). Bathroom was quite nice even though the hot in the shower was really really hot and cold was just room temperature!! Even though we were really close to the highway, the traffic did not disturb us. If you need to stay on Sheikh Zayed Road and are on a budget, this is a fantastic option at around USD 85 ++ per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great service with right price”
Reviews.Author: Srik1
Reviews.Content: In Holiday Inn Dubai it’s the most comfortable hotel in the dessert land. I was business trip and there were everything in the hotels was good, continental breakfast they serve is awesome and your day starts with having breakfast and they get ready to go the city sight seeing and shopping. Staff is very good in receiving, and the hotel is clean.. better choice of food whatever time of day, the gym on the top floor is good, the swimming pool area is a little on the small side, we can enjoy in the pool . This is my preferred hotel for business stay as it is very comfortable for the business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dicka1981
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Dubai for 1 week with my Mother for a holiday. Stayed in the holiday inn Al Barsha for 6 nights. In a great location as it is situated a minute walk away from the Mall of the Emirates. The rooftop pool is fantastic, with great views of the Burj and sometimes the Atlantis on the palm if its a clear day. Dont eat in the hotel as its so expensive. We had breakfast on our first morning and we paid £20 each!!!! Instead just pop to the mall and eat there as its very cheap and resonable, with lots of places to choose from. We also had a drink one night in the sports bar on the ground floor, myself and my mum were the only 2 women in there as it is full of men on business! Then a few women arrived, mostly Asian women who were all over the men and were obviously prostitutes!!! It was alittle suprising but fun to watch them around the men! Needless to say we only visited there once! We also took our own alcohol to Dubai with us and we took it out with us in water bottles each night as the alcohol overthere is so expensive, about £8-£10 for a standard glass of wine!!!! I know you are not suppossed to but we would just order a soft drink and add our own spirit, nobody even payed any attention! We managed to save atleast £200 by doing this. The rooftop bar is really nice to sit at night. There is alittle building work going on next door but it never bothered us and as you will see the whole of Dubai is a constant building site and will be for the next few years atleast! It wasnt noisy and didnt affect our holiday at all. The staff were all really helpful, especially the guy who works at the pool. He is like your own personal butler, laying your towels out for you and is very freindly and helpful. A little tip is to not take the hotel taxis. They approach you when you come out of the hotel and tell you to get it and i would have gotten in if i hadnt been warned previously. They charge you a fortune! The local taxis are all very safe and very cheap!!! (the only cheap thing in Dubai!) The room was big, clean and modern, with a large plasma that slides out on a tray. We received 2 free bottles of water every day also. I would definatly stay in this hotel again. It was perfect for myself and my mum as it was quiet during the day and had no children running around. There is always a sunbed available which was great! Located quite central so it was a short taxi ride to anywhere which was very handy. Dont hesitate to stay here!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Frsh & Contemporary”
Reviews.Author: brosam
Reviews.Content: Great place... gives a fresh feeling with its contemporary ambiance, which flows through its lobby to the rooms. The rooms were excellent, clean & spacious. I was in the standard room with a queen bed. Room service was quite prompt. The hotel staff was very courteous. Great variety on the breakfast menu. I was a bit disappointed by it location, although it overlooks the Burj-Al Arab. Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Business”
Reviews.Author: nnoturkar
Reviews.Content: My preferred Hotel for Business Stay in Dubai, though bit away from the hustle bustle of Dubai's Sheikh Zayed Road is at a place which is still very much in the city that is easily accesible from the Airport by Taxi & Dubai Metro. A preferred place to stay if you are travelling back to Al Quoz or going towards Jebel Ali Free Zone. The staff is helpful and cares well for the guests. The day starts with a quick work-out at the gymnasium situated at the 6th Floor and then the choice of International menu for the breakfast at "The Gem Garden" keeps you energetic throughout the day. Returning to the Hotel in the evening, it's not a bad idea to unwind either in the swimming pool or the sauna situated at the 6th floor. Feeling refreshed, it 's time to catch-up with your colleagues / friends at "Mojolito" over couple of drinks. "Mall of the Emirates" is at a walking distance from the Hotel and a quick shopping trip is possible without spending on Taxi. Dinner at Night can be enjoyed at the many restaurants the Hotel has, the one I like the most is "Gharana" - An Indian Restaurant or "The Royal Buddha" serving Thai cuisine. A sumptuous meal is sure to leave anybody satiated (especially if you dont carry the guilt of putting on those extra calories). Comparing the room tarrif, the cost of meals at the restaurants or the drinks at the lounge bars, the services offerred at Holiday Inn - Al Bersha is "quality at an affordable price".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Could find no fault”
Reviews.Author: AngeAde
Reviews.Content: This is the best Holiday Inn I have ever stayed in and what made it so good was the excellent food served in the 2 restaurants and the excellent bar. Service was excellent and the asia inspired restaurant made my holiday. Could find no fault the staff are a credit to Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bajapi
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here. The room was very nice and the best part was it was close to the mall where the indoor snow ski place is located. I'm glad I went there on business and not vacation in that it is very expensive in Dubai and not much to do. Very hot!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from Holiday Inn, nothing more or less.”
Reviews.Author: dazzking
Reviews.Content: Being a resident of Dubai for the past 2 years I stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights whilst in the process of relocating. Basically you get what you expect from the Holiday Inn brand from this hotel, a consistent level of service. I picked this hotel due to it's location being next door to the Mall of the Emirates and the Metro station, plus you get easy access to Sheik Zayed Road for your travels if you drive around Dubai. The hotel has several bars including a sports bar which offers extended happy hours throughout the week as well as a plethora of ladies of the night if that's your thing! The hotel is also additional guest friendly should you visit the sports bar or other venues in Dubai. Restaurants choice was reasonable and included very good Thai and Indian restaurants. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but no free internet access which I found a tad frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “from one hotelier to another I'm coming back”
Reviews.Author: juliacook61
Reviews.Content: We were also stranded due to the volcano and moved from the Marriott at the request of BA kicking and screaming I arrived .... I LOVED IT , great food, fantastic staff nothing to much trouble and great location I have rebooked and cant wait to return. Trust me I work in the industry ......

Reviews.Title: “Port in a storm”
Reviews.Author: christinesafc
Reviews.Content: Stranded as a result of the ash cloud, we checked in here having stayed at Dar Al Masyaf. Although located away from the beach, the roof top pool has fantastic views and the Mall of the Emirates is a short walk. The food is of an exceptional standard and the the staff are extremely efficient and friendly. We would not hesitate to stay here again as this is the best Holiday Inn we have stayed in. Special mention for Mohammed, the pool attendant and of course the chef!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: rmc291
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay in Dubai. Everything about this hotel is excellent especially the location now that the Metro is open. It is only a short walk to The Mall of the Emirates which is also the location of the Metro station. The room are large and comfortable with tea/coffee maker and two bottles of water are provided each day. The roof top pool is small but quite adequate and the staff first rate, bringing extra towels for our comfort and being attentive at all times. We have stayed at a beach hotel in the past but will definitely return to the Holiday Inn on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “feed well and slept well”
Reviews.Author: robbstar
Reviews.Content: this is a lovely new hotel top class stayed here because i was tired driving and just wanted somewhere to sleep ended up staying for three nights .its a lovly new spacious hotel nice bars and resturants good food in all of them tried them all there were some air line crew on a stopover stay so its a good sign of standards as well.the rooms have a hugh big comfy bed with lots of pilows again lovely clean bathrooms great night sleep also there is a nice pool on the roof with sundeck dont forget to use the steam or sauna room locations is great for shopping close to malls but far from beach the only two faults i found its close to a major motorway can be a bit noisy even when you beside the pool and dont use the hotel taxi he is twice or three time the price and he will go the longest way that he can find use a normal taxi

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel to explore "New Dubai"”
Reviews.Author: fema
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights in March 2010. It was offered by my travel agent and i picked it for the good reviews and location. No regrets at all! The hotel offers excellent value for a very competitive rate. Pros: Very fast check-in and check-out. We liked the hotel ambience, the curteous and efficient personnel, the yummy breakfast at the Gem garden, the nice rooms with all necessary amenities and the general areas. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. Very convenient location to explore all the hot spots in New Dubai. Just a few minutes walk to Mall of Emirates for shopping, eating or taking the metro! A few minutes drive to Jumeirah beach, JBR walk, Dubai Marina, Atlantis, Madinat Jumeirah. Not so far away also from Dubai Mall and Burj Khalifa, as far as Ibn Battuta Mall. In the Mall of Emirates one can take also the Big Bus to explore the city's major attractions. 20-30 mins drive to older parts of Dubai. The daily supply of mineral water and the coffee and tea making pot was appreciated much, as well as the two available cards to open the room and for electricity. Some minor cons or areas for improvement: the rooms are a little bit on the small side, but not inconveniently tiny. The position of the TV was not optimal for a room with twin beds, the system for lighting turn on/turn off was not very well designed. For example the turning on/off of the lamp next to my bed should be done from the other persons bed...There should be also more variety on toiletries offered. The bar at the lobby area was too smoky, which refused us from having a drink. A shuttle service to more places and free shuttle to airport, would be appreciated; as well as free internet at least at the lobby. To summarize, I would definitely stay again in this hotel and recommend it to friends! Keep it up with the good service and hospitality offered!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: bronia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here using Priority Club Points. Location ideal, being close to Mall of the Emirates and the metro and a short cab ride from The Marina and Walk. Shuttle bus to beach and Mall if needed. Impressive views of the Burj al Arab from the rooftop terrace and pool. Also could see Burj al Khalifa on a clear day and the Atlantis.
